snippet: Wyoming, which has been enriched by the sale of its natural resources, was the first state to reject new national science standards for schools, but it likely won’t be the last.
abstract: Wyoming is first state to reject new national science standards for schools, but it is likely not the last; schools are increasingly teaching students about climate change and Next Generation Science Standards have been adopted so far by 11 states and District of Columbia; teachings assert that human activity has affected climate.
lead_paragraph: Wyoming, which has been enriched by the sale of its natural resources, was the first state to reject new national science standards for schools, but it likely won’t be the last.

headline.main: Science Standards Divide a State Built on Coal and Oil
headline.print_headline: Science Standards Divide a State Built on Coal and Oil
